title: Data Science for Construction, Architecture and Engineering
description: Applied machine learning and data analytics techniques to BIM datasets, IoT logs, and construction scheduling problems.
highlights: Built a capstone model to predict energy consumption using features derived from CAD/Revit models
Completed an end-to-end applied data science capstone in a domain-specific setting

title: Generative AI for Creativity and Innovation
description: Explored multimodal generative workflows for creative asset generation using Adobe Firefly.
highlights: Applied generative tools for rapid UI/UX prototyping in student and hackathon projects
Gained hands-on exposure to multimodal generative design workflows

title: Foundations of Cloud Computing
description: Hands-on experience with AWS EC2, S3, and Lambda for deploying scalable applications.
highlights: Built small serverless prototypes integrating storage, compute, and event-driven workflows
Developed a foundational understanding of cloud infrastructure and serverless design patterns

title: Programming Essentials in Python (PCAP)
description: Covered Python OOP, data structures, exception handling, and file I/O.
highlights: Implemented small utilities and scripts to reinforce core programming concepts
Established a strong foundation in Python programming fundamentals

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: Introduced foundational AI concepts including search, planning, and reasoning under uncertainty.
highlights: Implemented simple Python agents for planning and pathfinding tasks
Built early familiarity with core AI problem-solving paradigms
